text: - I live in South Central.

If you wasn't born
here, you probably
wouldn't want to be here.

Two years ago, my life
was going down the drain.
That's what it felt like.

I wasn't doing what I was
supposed to be doing-- ditching
class, skipping school.

HARRY GRAMMER: How many of
y'all got friends out there
right now, just on the block.
- I do.
- I do.

HARRY GRAMMER: Growing
up, I spent five
years on juvenile probation.
I became very lost.

I think many of our young
people feel the same way.
This is a flow class.
It's about going inside.
It is about telling your story.

Bottom line is,
everybody in this room,

including myself, we've
got a story to tell.

We work mainly with kids that
are in risk of being dropped

out of their high schools,
being incarcerated, being
in the streets.

They can come here and
find themselves a home.

There's a million places
you could be right now,
but you here.

We have a community
center in Los Angeles
with full wrap-around services.

Counseling, therapy, mentorship
programs, vocational programs.

We have a high school
diploma educational program.
Tell them.

You're going to tell the
world about who you are.

I want to see what
you have inside
of you that wants to come out.

Flow is our flagship program
that helps young people tell

their story, turn their
story into poetry,

turn their poetry into music,
and their music into the songs.

- (SINGING) Gonna
tell 'em your story,
how you won't go [inaudible].
Go and tell 'em your story.
- Basically, like, laced me.

It's like he tied me
up, tied my shoes up.

HARRY GRAMMER: If
you want to make

your last arrest
your last arrest,
you're in the right place.

Seven days a week, we also go
to detention facilities in Los

Angeles County,
and we try to build

a family, a team, a
safe space for everyone
to express themselves.

- My life was really
different from what it is now.

I can't believe I
got to this day.
It's crazy.
It's mind blowing.
It's mind boggling.
It's like, how did do this?
- You finally here.
How you feel?
- Man, I feel good.

HARRY GRAMMER: We need to
listen to our your people.

We need to find out
what it is that they're
longing for, what they want.

- Please give it up for the
New Earth 2017 students.

HARRY GRAMMER: We
provide the whole piece

to help them land
safely on their feet

and to move forward
powerfully and be productive.

We are--
STUDENTS: --unstoppable!

HARRY GRAMMER: We are--
STUDENTS: --unstoppable!

HARRY GRAMMER: Yeah!
Come on, y'all.
All right.
